summary: This document contains Bureau of Prisons TRUVIEW reports and commissary sales invoices for inmate Jeffrey Epstein at the New York MCC in 2019. It shows money sent to him via Western Union from two individuals and details his purchases from the prison commissary.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The primary subject of the financial records, identified as inmate #76318054 at the New York Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC). The documents track money sent to him and his commissary purchases.

persons.name: Efrain Reyes
persons.context: Sent $200 via Western Union to inmate Jeffrey Epstein on August 7, 2019, according to a Bureau of Prisons TRUVIEW report.

persons.name: Ruben Rugard
persons.context: Sent $200 via Western Union to inmate Jeffrey Epstein on July 8, 2019, according to a Bureau of Prisons TRUVIEW report. Listed with an address in New York.

connections.description: Reyes sent $200 to Epstein via Western Union while Epstein was incarcerated.

events.description: Jeffrey Epstein purchased items including batteries, soap, shower shoes, and hydrocortisone from the MCC commissary.

events.title: Epstein Commissary Purchase
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein purchased items including batteries, Advil, antifungal cream, a radio, and vitamins from the MCC commissary.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was held as inmate #76318054 at the New York Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in 2019.
Two individuals, Efrain Reyes and Ruben Rugard, each sent $200 to Epstein via Western Union in July and August 2019.
Epstein's commissary purchases included basic hygiene items, over-the-counter medications, batteries, and an AM/FM radio.
The financial records show Epstein's inmate account balance fluctuating with deposits and commissary charges.
The documents are Bureau of Prisons TRUVIEW reports and sales invoices, marked as Sensitive But Unclassified (SBU).
